author: m.kalinin
content: good question. I don't think on EL side the order is defined anywhere, while on CL side deposits field is the first from the two

author: m.kalinin
content: I would order by EIP number by default, not sure if there is any other criteria in this particular case

author: ralexstokes
content:
i think it is easier to reason about (on a specs level) and safer to implement if the fields are generally ordered as "all things that generate some state, all things that mutate this state, all things that destroy this state"

e.g. deposits would come before exits following this scheme

the spec should be written for it to not really matter but i know there are places in the CL spec where order does matter, and so i think aligning with "lifecycle flow" best matches both spec writers and implementer's mental models, so it ends up being better than other orderings

author: ralexstokes
content: if we are just going to bikeshed it much further, then i'd say EIP-numbering is the most neutral solution
